website_summaries.verdict: A strong magnetic bar that's a couple of inches longer than other models that sell for the same price.
pros: Its longer length means more storage for knives and other metal gadgets
Frees drawer space and eliminates the need for a bulky knife block
cons: Mounting hardware is included, but installation instructions are not, posing a challenge for some owners

customer_reviews.title: The bar I received does hold heavy items but the back is hollow making installation difficult.
customer_reviews.text: I won the magnet lottery: My 9 ounce 8" chef's knife clings perfectly to this magnetic bar. No matter where I place the knife, the knife won't budge. That's wonderful. But (isn't there always a but?) the back is hollow. I need a flat back to attach to my granite wall. I intend to use industrial Velcro. When the weather improves I'll cut a slice of plywood and epoxy the plywood to fill the back of the magnet bar. I currently have a magnetic knife holder attached to the wall with Velcro but the magnets are too weak to hold the 8" knife. Finding the right knife magnet bar has turned into a multi-month nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Customer since 1918

customer_reviews.title: Happy Cooking!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic piece of kitchen appliance. Instead of making holes and screwing in the screws that come with it, I used strong command strips instead. I used the ones that can hold 12 lbs. Two on each end running parallel with the strip and then placed it on the wall. It can hold all my major knives. I have two Victorinox knivesand a colored set from Cusisinart. Both of which I also highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Sieglaff

customer_reviews.title: Mounting is an issue.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -The magnets are a good length and quite strong. Easily able to hold up more than would spatially fit along the length. -No visible screws Cons: -To hide the screws, the mounting system is somewhat involved. It's quite difficult to mount. If the screws are too tight, you the side pieces might not fit. Or worse, you might peel paint off the wall with friction. If not tight enough, it gets wobbly. Even with the screws as tight as I can get without peeling the paint on my walls, the whole bar wobbles in the whatever direction you move the knife.
customer_reviews.author: ixd735

customer_reviews.title: Not quite strong enough
customer_reviews.text: This is a knife holder like any other, nothing great, nothing awful. I have more knives than I can fit on a standard 12-inch holder, so this one looked good. It's okay. If you bump a knife even a little, it falls, so you have to be careful to avoid the other handles. We usually move every few years, so when I have it to do over again, I'll buy a pair of the shorter holders from IKEA. I never can get those lined up perfectly, but they've always held my knives.
customer_reviews.author: Phrits

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous- Falls down easily!
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem is that because of the design it's DANGEROUS. It seems secure when it's first installed or when the knifes are just hanging there...but if I'm not extremely careful when pulling a knife off,the black end pops off and the whole strip falls down! Easy to install, once you play around a bit or look online....but does not come with directions which I could see being very frustrating for some people. I would not recommend using this for knives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very strong for holding knives
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the second one we have purchased. We wanted to add a second bar due to the fact we don't like to have knives in a drawer with other utensils. I tend to be very accident prone and especially when it involves sharp objects. Be sure to mount it by the plastic end caps.
customer_reviews.author: sassyforever

customer_reviews.title: Works on the Fridge!
customer_reviews.text: My apartment is from the early 1900s and we can't put anything near the walls or I lose my deposit. I saw on here someone stuck this bar to their fridge and I was a bit skeptic, but thought I'd give it a try. High fives all around because it totally worked! Best thing I've purchased in awhile and it's so nice to have all of the knives on the side of the fridge. I purchased a roll of "Scotch Heavy Duty Mounting Tape" and put that tape all over the back of the aluminum bar. It's been up for a month now and seems study!
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlea

customer_reviews.title: Good but removal could be an issue
customer_reviews.text: Holds knives with just the right amount magnetism as the knives stay secured and can be easily lifted off. Because of the way that the bar clips into the mounts, I installed 1/4" plastic spacers to mount the bar off of the surface. If you were to try to remove the bar after installation w/o the spacers you'll likely damage the mounting surface. Since I installed this onto the refrigerator surround panels and was able to get to the other side from where the bar was installed, I used machine screws w/ nuts to also allow easier removal. Bars that allow access to the mounting screws are a better design for wall mounting if future removal is desired.
customer_reviews.author: BradleyM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic holder works great and holds a lot of knives securely. It could easily be used in shop for misc. tools. The mounting was a little tricky and could probably be designed better, but overall it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Howard

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do...
customer_reviews.text: It definitely holds a lot of stuff and they stay on very strong but the bar itself can only be installed horizontally. We tried doing it vertically on the side of one of our cabinets but it just doesn't stay up. It does what it's supposed to do but we'll have to find another spot for it if we want to use it (we have a pretty small kitchen so there's not a lot of space for it go horizontally).
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Get this
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought one sooner. If you're find with drilling holes in your kitchen walls and have the wall space, highly recommend buying one of these. We put it over our sink so it's easy to grab a knife to use and put away after it's washed and dried. We also have a knife block because we have a number of knives, but it takes up counter space and one more thing to move and clean under.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for people who have a lot of knives.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I got my mom a knife set. I noticed she would just put the knifes in the drawer and most of them were starting to get chipped. When I bought her a knife set I didn't want her to treat them like the did the others so I got her the magnetic strip. She could not have been happier with them. She now has easy access to her knives and the life span of them will be better.
customer_reviews.author: axsolorz

customer_reviews.title: The bar is long enough to easily hold at least one 6'' chef's knife and 11 ...
customer_reviews.text: The bar is long enough to easily hold at least one 6'' chef's knife and 11 paring knives. Mine came a bit dented on one end with the plastic cap cracked, but I repaired it and it isn't noticeable. The back of the bar is hollow, which, in my case, worked well because I glued magnets and attached it to the side of the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: F. Woolridge

customer_reviews.title: Got rid of some counter clutter
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the wall mounted knife holder. It replaced a large wooden counter top holder. I was trying to cut down on my counter top clutter so this was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen H

customer_reviews.title: magnet is pretty strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from Chicago cutlery that was not as long. I noticed that this one has a stronger magnet on it, though it was pretty much identical in look (except for the length of course). The other strip has worked fine, but I noticed that my new Shun chef's knife won't attach to the chicago one without slipping unless put it up close to the hilt. Not expecting the same issue with this one. I have yet to put it up, but I could tell the difference in magnet strength right away. Wish I had gotten this originally.
customer_reviews.author: Mochizzes

customer_reviews.title: Totally love it!
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the reviews and was a little bit worried about how I was going to attach it to the wall above the sink. I didn't want to drill into the granite in order to mount it. I glued the plastic end pieces on with Gorilla glue and then used Command tabs to mount it on the wall. The whole process took about 15 minutes and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Gave me more space.
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these and have only put one of them up (laziness) I got them because counter space is very limited in my kitchen and out knife block takes up a decent sized space that we could be better used for something else. I knew the measurements before I bought them but having it on the while it looks pretty big and fit all the knives we use along with a utility scissor. Leveling it and mounting it are very easy. The magnets themselves are very strong and I have zero worry that a knife would fall off under any normal circumstance. Worth the money for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Yeti

customer_reviews.title: Bang for Buck
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for obvious reasons: Price and Function. Product works fantastic with 7-piece knife set attached. As others have stated, do NOT use mounting hardware included. Do yourself a favor and pick up a set of drywall anchors from your local hardware store. Follow these steps: 0.) Measure Twice. 1.) Drill hole to size for anchors. Insert anchors. 2.) Screw in mounting screws to anchors. 3.) Pull black tabs away from knife bar. 4.) Mount tabs to wall, hand tighten. 5.) Snap knife bar into attached tabs. 6.) Ensure mounting is sturdy, it my move slightly but this is the 'give' of the plastic tabs. 7.) Attach knives, purchase fewer bandaids related to fumbling in drawers for knives.
customer_reviews.author: Talio

customer_reviews.title: Very strong!
customer_reviews.text: Very strong magnets to hold multiple heavy knives! I have a custom made granite handled knife I was worried about this being able to hold but it has no problem with it at all!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Not huge but does the job. Makes using my knifes much easier. I have been looking for one for awhile — this is just the right size. Good addition to my kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It works. The magnets hold really well, and the set comes with mounting screws and drywall anchors so that it can be installed securely. I got two of the 18" bars and hung one about 2' above the other. The top one holds my cleavers, carving knife and fork, and a couple other knives I don't use so often, and the other holds two chef's knives, a good-sized boning knife, bread knife, and several other small to mid-sized knifes. Eight knives in all on that one, and it's not too cramped to get to any of them safely. As for Amazon, happy as always. I used the free super saver shipping and got my order super quick.
customer_reviews.author: umanota

customer_reviews.title: They're all super handy. The bar was a breeze to mount ...
customer_reviews.text: We have a knife bar in our small cabin in the mountains so when we bought our new home I wanted the same convenient access to my knives. My husband and I both cook together and this bar is so accessible-you don't have to go rummaging around in a drawer for a particular knife. They're all super handy. The bar was a breeze to mount on the wall and looks quite smart-kinda like you really know what you're doing in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie53

customer_reviews.title: Organization.
customer_reviews.text: Great for clearing out drawers, getting rid of the knife block clearing counter space. All my knives are in one spot out of sight.
customer_reviews.author: Butch

customer_reviews.title: Good product other than the installation hardware.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product for the price. Our new knife sticks nicely to it. Don't waste your time with the sheet rock anchors. They were some sort of pentagon shaped green plastic and once emplacement they stripped the sheet rock wall and just spun when the screw was turned. I then had to find plyers to remove the screw from the anchor. Do yourself a favor and go to the hardware store or better yet order some real sheet rock anchors, the ones that are threaded and screw in. It will be way less frustrating. Other than that, I really like this product.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, read the comments here for help
customer_reviews.text: Once it's installed, it's great. It loses a star for the effort to get it to that point. No instructions to speak of and I feel sorry for anyone who bought this in a shop and didn't have access to the internet to find out. Many thanks to the reviewers who filled in the gaps. Hell, even the towel ring I just bought came with a full page sheet of instructions. Get with it, Norpro.
customer_reviews.author: AGS

customer_reviews.title: Get your counter space back
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality product and helped me save a lot of space on my counter. I got rid of my knife block entirely and mounted this next to the stove above my countertop. It is attractive and my knives are right at hand anytime I need them. This is excellent if your kitchen is small. All counter space is valuable so chuck that knife block you don't need it. This helps also to rid your kitchen of uneeded clutter.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Gregory

customer_reviews.title: We previously used a knife block because we don't like our knives in drawers (they get dull more easily ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this to store knives to save counter space. We previously used a knife block because we don't like our knives in drawers (they get dull more easily and we have a toddler that digs through the drawers). I'll never own a knife block again. The magnet is strong and comfortably holds our knives, it doesn't make me nervous, and it was very easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to hang my knives at my new apartment. Now that I am finally settled and can get around to installing all of the stuff I bought, I opened up the box and the plastic had snapped off the ends, probably lending credence to how sturdy this product is overall. But I will never know, since this is not mountable or glue-able since the plastic splintered into many little pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store your knives!
customer_reviews.text: Love this useful item. This purchase is for a gift for someone with as many or more knives than I have. Easy to hang up, knives and other utensils attach firmly, nothing drops off of it, wonderful way to display your knives, easy access and free up some drawer space. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CNY Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy & Durable!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install (after reading others reviews). Does not come with clear instructions, but I was able to easily figure out how to install it. It is very sturdy and holds my kitchen knives well. I love the convenience of having them on the wall, easy to grab. I may purchase another for the other side of my kitchen. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I now have all my knives hanging on the wall very easy to access. And it has cleared out One of my kitchen drawers. I have colorful knives and they all look nice on the wall. I was worried about the strength of the magnet, but as I use it, the magnet strength is just perfect for putting the knives up and taking the knives off the strip.
customer_reviews.author: Kickin' It

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Firm
customer_reviews.text: Really great knife rack. This knife rack mounts easily with the included screws. I put mine over my stove and it looks great, it's long enough for all my knives, and holds them firmly. The magnets are strong enough to hold even my large heavy chef knife securely but are not so strong that you have problems removing the knives. It does have some trouble holding my steel, but that could just be the round shape. Nonetheless I would recommend this to anyone looking to save counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Happy about it
customer_reviews.text: I attached it with Command strips to my wall since we are renting so it's kind of wobbly but does the job quite well despite that!
customer_reviews.author: Brooke A.

customer_reviews.title: Great knife rack
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made product. I bought two of these and have all of my kitchen knives mounted. I recommend reading the other reviews in regards to mounting. The mounting screws were fine that came with it, but I used some larger drywall anchors. The black end pieces slide out, so mount one side, then measure between the center of the screw holes. Once you have the second mounting screw installed, you can use a rubber mallet or something similar to tap the other black end cap on.
customer_reviews.author: D Cole

customer_reviews.title: It's not easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: It's not easy to mount. Be aware of that. I read all of the reviews for the hints. Yes, the ends come off. Doesn't matter. Still hard to mount. Having said that, it's possible to make it sturdy and solid and it's exactly what I was looking for after it was up. So do some cussing and throw a screwdriver at the wall and once that's done it's great.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Sellars

customer_reviews.title: Would have been good if I didn't get the broken one
customer_reviews.text: One of the clips on the mounting brackets was broken. I didn't want the hassle of sending it back so i drilled through the aluminium direct to the wall
customer_reviews.author: Lrthree

customer_reviews.title: Great bar, needs some thought to install
customer_reviews.text: To install this (there are no instructions) put in the anchors, install one of the ends on the wall,and on the other end just put in the screw with a little distance from the wall. Put the other end on the bar, hold it in place, and slide the bar onto the installed bracket and the screw. A strong, stable magnet that reliably holds my 7 knives with room to spare.
customer_reviews.author: SJT

customer_reviews.title: Great looking magnetic bar with no exposed screws
customer_reviews.text: Great looking magnetic bar with no exposed screws. Ironically, no exposed screws means you might pull your hair out while installing it, but you'll be happy when it's up. I ended up having to cut it down by about 6 inches. The modification was easy. We know have two of these installed in the kitchen and I'm thinking of getting one for my tool room for things that shouldn't get thrown into a drawer (wood chisel, etc).
customer_reviews.author: hazel314

customer_reviews.title: Makes my kitchen look great!
customer_reviews.text: They go on the wall very easily and I haven't had any problems with them. Only downside is not the whole thing is magnetic, just two tiny strips on it. But so far no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Graham

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. I bought one almost two years ago when I moved into my somewhat small apartment (with a very small kitchen). I decided to order a second one this weekend to maximize my easy access knife and metal utensil storage.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: DEFINITE BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son's new apartment as I've had this for a few years in mind and LOVE the space it saves. Buying another as I'm moving to a new apartment and couldn't be without it. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: MeMe LaMer

customer_reviews.title: Good Instructional Video and Included Anchors Make This Knife Bar a Winner
customer_reviews.text: Works great with the knife set I bought (Utopia Kitchen multi-colored set). The included anchors for plaster came in very handy, as well as the attached YouTube video describing the installation.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Gautam Hota

customer_reviews.title: Good knife bar but needs instructions in the box.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is meant to do. Follow the instructions from the reviewers here at Amazon dot com: there are none in the box. Measure / lay out the position of the knife bar precisely, then remove the end caps, screw the end caps into the mounting surface, then snap the bar in place, over the end caps. Do all of that correctly and the bar will not wiggle.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The Item does exactly what it's supposed to do. Extremely easy to mount and at first I was a little worried about the strength of the magnet with my knives. The magnet itself is more then strong enough to hold most heavy knives and should be easy enough for most people to just pull their knives off. So far after having it almost 2 months I have zero complaints about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Just hung the magnet today. Looks pretty good and a pretty strong magnet too. I think the 12 inch bar might be a little too small for the average cook. Good quality, very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: RN4USMC

customer_reviews.title: This is the model recommended by Cooks Illustrated
customer_reviews.text: This is the model recommended by Cooks Illustrated. It's a great product--I agree with CI that it's useable length is a major major plus over other models that don't extend the magnet so far to the ends. Downside for me: It is not easy to install using command strips as I had hoped since I didn't want to drill into my kitchen tile. I may repurpose in our tool room or craft space/office!
customer_reviews.author: Lila G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, I'm glad I didn't get a shorter product. This is 18imches and I'd think you wouldn't want less as you can see by my photo. Very good quality, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Moore

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy magnet.
customer_reviews.text: It has somewhat of a wimpy magnet, as the knives tend to slide, which frankly scares me.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Great product, quality and solid buy for anyone who ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product, quality and solid buy for anyone who has any type of metal kitchen appliances or gray/silver kitchen accessories. Holds my whole knife kit perfect and sturdy and looks extremely professional in my home kitchen. Solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Could use some mounting instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Needs to enclose mounting instructions to make it easier to mount. How far apart are the holes to be drilled? What is the bit dimension to use for the screw mounting? Once installed it works very well. It is sturdy and holds the knives securely.
customer_reviews.author: Phil G

customer_reviews.title: Matches SS appliances and securly holds knives
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a magnetic knife bar for over 10 years and I love them! My last one was black and I got this one to go with my stainless steel appliances. It goes great and holds all my knives very well. Nice solid hold, doesn't feel like they are going to fall off. Great product and I plan on having it for 10 years more.
customer_reviews.author: Nisus

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Make sure you measure your kitchen space ...
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Make sure you measure your kitchen space first and actually measure out the length your knives require. I just used a hammer and a screw driver and mounted it to my drywall with no issues. I don't understand everyone issue with it falling off and being weak. I isn't even have the right tools for it to be "mounted."
customer_reviews.author: Connie Chen

customer_reviews.title: It's in my kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Drilled it into the wall and never looked back. Installation can be tricky, but if you use your noodle, you'll have a snug level fit. Magnets are strong enough without being too sticky. One star deduction because there are better looking ones out there, but this is a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Great for any kitchen.
customer_reviews.text: It may feel light as you would think heavy because of magnets and metal. However it works very well and is easily installed. I would buy a second if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Max Fisher

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: Investigating and measuring to find a knife that fits the space in our kitchen, I replaced an old one which was not as solid as this one. It holds all the knives and kitchen tools you can stuff onto its length if you want to, making them easy to get at and holds them on the knife bar securely.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say about this item it's a magnetic knife holder. It looks really cool with my kitchen knives attached to it I get a lot of comments about how nice it looks. Attaching it to the wall with a simple as two drywall screws, all in all only took about seven minutes. The knife holder looks really well-built, and the magnetic part of the holder holds the knives on really well I'm not concerned about the knives falling off at all.
customer_reviews.author: david latham

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had this much sooner! A great space saver for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Wilson

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive and high quality, love how it is extra long
customer_reviews.text: I used 3M strips and it holds really well. Cheap deal for a nice quality product
customer_reviews.author: KAF_EmpireState

customer_reviews.title: Anchors Suck!
customer_reviews.text: I have all my knives on this in our full time RV and 4 are heavy, including a pair of kitchen scissors. It hold all them and even on bumpy roads, they have held. I didn't notice any "marking" on my knives and since they are stainless steel, don't think it would show. Giving 4 stars because the anchors suck! Throw them away and purchase American ones.
customer_reviews.author: Mickie

customer_reviews.title: Magnet may not be strong enough for heavier knives.
customer_reviews.text: Not too hard to mount, but not super easy either. The magnet isn't very strong and I wasn't confident that my knife wouldn't fall down if someone slammed the door going out to the garage so I returned it. I'm not sure if this is normal for this product or not.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: we buy this like that my son can not have accès to the ...
customer_reviews.text: It is several years I want one, we buy this like that my son can not have accès to the knifes. And it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: nicolas pecheral

customer_reviews.title: Fell behind the stove within a week!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because Cooks Illustrated recommended it. My guess is that the magazine staff scrapped the original mounting hardware and rigged something themselves, which makes it an odd choice for a high rating. I used the mounting device included, and put it above the stove. The entire thing came crashing down behind the stove within a week! I'm really bummed that this didn't work yet very happy that nobody got hurt in the process. I have standard drywall, nothing weird. I don't know any other mounting hardware to use. I've read other negative reviews of items rated highly by Cooks Illustrated, and I'm beginning to lose confidence in them. Now, I need another knife solution!
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: ... research for a magnetic knife bar and couldn't be happier with the safety and security of this one
customer_reviews.text: I did plenty of research for a magnetic knife bar and couldn't be happier with the safety and security of this one. It holds my precious $100 knife and 6 others with plenty of room. Highly recommend this one, especially for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Christy R

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately
customer_reviews.text: Broke right out of the package!!! Seriously!!! So disappointed. This was a gift for my step dad and I am so embarrassed!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Fits all my kitchen knives, with not used counter space.
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I might complain about is that when I pull larger knives off the magnetic bar seems to want to come with it. Though this could just be an insulation error on my husbands part. Not so sure. Just as other reviews say there are no instructions.
customer_reviews.author: FactorysFav

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to hang it up in about 10 minutes. It holds scissors, 10 knives. Looks good. Magnets are strong, no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: Unique cutlery saver.
customer_reviews.text: The Norpro 18 Inch Aluminum Magnetic Knife Bar is a unique way to save the integrity of your cutlery and have any knife conveniently available at a glance. Wish I had purchased this handy tool long ago. I Highly recommend this magnetic knife bar to any one who uses knives on a regular basis, and it makes a nice addition to the decor of your kitchen, at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: After my knife block split in half (don't know how that happened) I decided to put a magnetic knife holder on the wall to free up counter space since I have a small kitchen and very little counter space. The installation was quick and easy. I absolutely love it. Would definitely recommend this product to anyone looking to use wall space rather than counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install and such a great way to save ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and such a great way to save space in the kitchen. Just make sure you've tightened and aligned the screws so nothing wobbles.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: ... this is perfectly displaying my Tramontina knives that absolutely love!!
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time with mine since I have small tile but this is perfectly displaying my Tramontina knives that absolutely love!!!
customer_reviews.author: -E*

customer_reviews.title: Great storage off the counter tops
customer_reviews.text: I have such limited counter space, I simply needed a better place to store knives than a bulky block. This installed so easily (level, drill, pencil), and is very sturdy. I store 11 knives of various sizes on it. It holds them securely, but they're still easy to pull off the knife bar.
customer_reviews.author: J. BurnettTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Holds my knives and other kitchen tools very well. I have not experienced any difficulties with this product. It looks very sleek and enabled me to get rid of my bulky knife block. It holds 6 large knives easily and there was room to spare for kitchen shears and a couple of pairs of tongs. It makes my knives so accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Roy O'Del

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic for anyone without a lot of counter space - I was able to get rid of my huge wooden knife block and free up some valuable counter real estate. Plus, you can see exactly which knife you're reaching for - love it, I think I'll keep using it even after our kitchen addition is done.
customer_reviews.author: C. Eagleson

customer_reviews.title: Practical kitchen hardware to protect your knives
customer_reviews.text: I love having my knives safely hanging on the wall, as opposed to being in a bacteria-ridden knife block or in a drawer. It adds to the kitchen aesthetic too. Installation is rather easy, however it can be a challenge to get it feeling very secure against the wall. Mine is a bit loose after taking down a knife several times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Censky

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality item.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and works great. No surprises here, this knife bar holds knives with just enough tension to make sure they're not going anywhere. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: BakeronMowbray

customer_reviews.title: Knives At the Ready...
customer_reviews.text: I love this knife holder. It keeps your cutlery at the ready, out of drawers (dangerous), clean, and dry. The magnet is good and strong and will hold any metal knife securely. I left this one at the house I sold and am buying another for the new house. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: R. Frame

customer_reviews.title: Powerful magnet
customer_reviews.text: This bar works as it should, holding knives perfectly perpendicular to the floor. I'm not sure how well the included mounting system works, as I had originally planned (and did) installing it on a pegboard type backing. I used wire and glue. It's strong enough to hold up my largest santoku knives, and I even stick my cheese grater and pizza cutter on there.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua E. Frazer

customer_reviews.title: Not very much magnetic power knives stick nothing to heavy ...
customer_reviews.text: Not very much magnetic power knives stick nothing to heavy no scissors with plastic on blade they will not stick holds 5 - 6 large knives I will be upgrading to something stronger in the future
customer_reviews.author: erik

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Apartment Dwellers
customer_reviews.text: I have very limited drawer/counter space in my apartment. I put this over my stove and it's fantastic and has a strong magnet. A must have for an apartment
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, works as it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this knife bar, installed it, and it works fine. Nice to have my knives right where I need them and easy to grab. I like it much better than the knife block it replaces....the worst part was drilling the holes in the tile to mount it....and even that wasn't too much of a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Ditch the packaged hardware and use your own for a super stable, highly magnetized, knife bar. Thing holds on like mad - but not enough where it is impossible to pull a knife off. I would definitely suggest grabbing on if you are in need. They are cheap, well built, and shockingly sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Cuellar

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to hang
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to hang. Holds knifes really well. I have large heavy blades on it, like my 7" cleaver. I paid full Amazon price for this knife rack.
customer_reviews.author: BryMom

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I didn't give it 5 stars is because someone may have an issue with not having installation instructions. I had to think about it a minute but that was it. Just measure, put screws in wall, hold magnetic part between screws, then slide black caps onto ends to lock into screws. Not wobbly at all! I ordered an $80 one from Williams Sonoma that I liked because it was longer, but as a gift to my mom, she accidentally saw receipt and had me return it. Oops! Hesitant about this MUCH cheaper version but thrilled with it! Seems like the same one but shorter. Glad we made switch. Worth it people, I swear!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicoremus

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to have our knives within reach from basically anywhere in the kitchen (small kitchen, of course). Installation was easy enough; slide plastic ends out, I used drywall screws, slide back in. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not bad. Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Great for steak Knives.Don't put cleavers or quality chef knives on rack it is under powered. Price is reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.ChuckleTrousers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Handy for keeping knives within reach but out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: Gwenfron

customer_reviews.title: Great knife Bar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife bar. It has a powerful magnet that holds a heavy bone cleaver and chinese cleaver as well as more traditional knives in my kitchen. Mounting is easy but i do wish it was a bit more solidly mounted as it does bend out when you pull a heavy knife off of it, but it works well nevertheless.
customer_reviews.author: Tyrannosaurusii

customer_reviews.title: Just buy this one and stop looking everywhere else!
customer_reviews.text: Came in late. 5 stars because it looks great. Very functional. Very sturdy. Have had for a couple months and use it daily, no wear or tear yet.
customer_reviews.author: Melsch

customer_reviews.title: Strong magnet, works well but hard to mount.
customer_reviews.text: I found this hard to mount (I had to get help) but once mounted worked quite well. The problem was getting the included wall anchors to work. The magnet is quite strong though so it holds the knives well.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Totally love it
customer_reviews.text: This magnetic knife bar is the best thing since sliced bread. It really grips and holds your knives well. I intend to get another one for my kitchen. If you have limited counter space, you'll be able to toss that wooden knife block and mount those knives on the wall. Frees up a lot of counter space.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Chicken Lady

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: I hung it vertically, despite reading other reviews which told me that didn't work. Its been hanging there for about a month now and working perfectly. I have it completely full too... so even with the added weight of a lot of large knives, it is still holding strong. great product, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Magnetic knife bar
customer_reviews.text: I have just installed the knife holders in a second house. Used each time for my many kitchen knives. Nothing works better for the job. Easy to install once you get the hang of it. Over the years, a bunch of people ask me where you get these.
customer_reviews.author: BJB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Look and has great magnetic grab to the products you place on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Good finish and very strong magnets. No worries that the knives are going to fall off, even heavy handled knives with thin blades (e.g. fillet knives). Enough material on the back to use temporary sticky strips to mount to the wall (for renters or those who don't want to drill through their back splash).
customer_reviews.author: James Redwine

customer_reviews.title: Terrible mounting system
customer_reviews.text: I would not recomend this magnet, based simply on the poor mounting design. I ended up having to drill holes through the front of the bar, making it look sloppy. I use it in the garage because the screws sticking out make it look bad in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the new magnetic knife storage bar for several weeks now and I love it. I had two knife sets (both in big blocks) that took up alot of room on the cabinet top. The 18-inch storage bar not only cleared the cabinet top space, but it's handy and strong enough to hold even the biggest knives securely. A great solution for any cook!
customer_reviews.author: Karen Brock Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Really strong magnet and works well.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty self explanatory on the product. Magnet is really strong which is nice. No worries about knives falling off. Also, the extra length is awesome compared to the standard 12 inch ones I mostly found. The only knock is the attaching this item to the wall. Probably not the most self-explanatory method and I don't think there was instructions when it arrived. However, I looked it up online and just really figured it out after some thought. But it took a little effort (not a lot more than usual really but some).
customer_reviews.author: Keith Sparks

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, pain to install
customer_reviews.text: This comes with no installation instructions whatsoever and the mounting hardware was poorly designed. Once it was up, it looks and acts just like the picture. If I get another one, I'll shop for a different brand in hopes of an easier installation.
customer_reviews.author: Ramonabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: One of the top magnetic product in the market. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jai Rox

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to install. Holds my knifes firmly but releases them with a twist easily.
customer_reviews.author: C.U. Soon

product_meta.title: Norpro 18-Inch Aluminum Magnetic Knife Bar
product_meta.description:
Package Quantity:1| Size:1.8 x 0.8 x 19.2 inches

Measures: 18" x 1.25' x .5" / 45.5cm x 3cm x 1.25cm. Our beautiful magnetic knife bars grip securely, yet easily releases knives, kitchen gadgets and tools. A compact, convenient and practical holder looks gorgeous in all decor, while keeping you feel organized and efficient. Perfect for the kitchen, workshop or garage. Protect your knife blades from damage by not jamming them into drawers and knife blocks. Features permanent extra strength magnetism. Made of aluminum. Installs easily with screws included. Extended length to hold more while still compact enough to conveniently fit in any nook. Hand washing recommended.

 Norpro was founded in 1973 with a vision to design, manufacture, and supply the highest caliber kitchenware. Norpro’s offering of innovative, high quality product for cooking, preparing and serving food are produced with superior materials and craftsmanship.
feature_bullets: Our beautiful magnetic knife bars grip securely, yet easily releases knives, kitchen gadgets and tools. A compact, convenient and practical holder looks gorgeous in all decor, while keeping you feel organized and efficient. Perfect for the kitchen, workshop or garage.
Protect your knife blades from damage by not jamming them into drawers and knife blocks.
Extended length to hold more while still compact enough to conveniently fit in any nook.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,151 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
